reviews.sentence: Great place to stay. I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel with my group that I travel with every year during the Martin Luther King Holiday. We have traveled together for the last 18 years but I have never received as many compliments from my group as I have concerning this hotel. The staff were a pleasure to work with to book the hotel and once we arrived the staff throughout the hotel were always professional and made our stay one that my group is still complimenting. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel was in the perfect location to all the surrounding sites. Thank you Talbot staff for making me the queen of planning my group has flooded me with compliments for picking the Talbot.

A Mother and Daughters Outing. The staff was amazing and extremely helpful. We arrived early and we quickly had the car unloaded and luggage stored while the valet then took charge of parking the car. The room was very spacious for the three of us and the double sinks enabled three females to get ready much easier than sharing a single sink. Looking forward to going back.

Friendly convenient and spacious. Everyone at the Talbot is extraordinarily friendly and helpful. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and were never made to feel that we were lesser customers because we were weekend family tourists. Having said that though I will acknowledge we were given a room with a view of the building directly behind nothing scenic but it could have been what was available at early check inThe location was fabulous on the near north side just a few blocks from Muchigan Avenue. There are lots of shops and restaurants in the area including two great cupcake places. The area is bustling and feels very safe and we were able to let our teenager go off shopping and exploring on his own. Our room was very spacious and our special requests for foam pillows and a mini fridge were already in the room and at no extra charge. That reminds me that the Talbot has a nice online early check in process so we could make specific requests and it sent us a text to let us know the room was ready. The decor old English with dark wood and leather was a bit fussy for our tastes but was nicely done in its own style. Our room had two queen beds an armoire with drawers hanging space a keyed mini bar a safe and a TV along with a large desk and chair and two easy chairs with a shared coffee table and lamp. There was a lot of open floor space which was lovely. The only complaint we had was that the toiletries were heavily perfumed citrus and sandlewod and gave me a headache and I am not particularly sensitive. With some effort the staff was able to track down some less smelly products. We would definitely stay here again but might bring our own toiletries.

Elegant and Homey. Visited with family members for a mix of business and pleasure. We have not stayed at this property 3 times and it has been consistently good. Friendly people excellent service and beautifully appointed rooms.

October 2017 Trip. Stayed in the Talbot Hotel in Chicago on our trip to USA and the hotel was excellent. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the friendly staff could not do enough to help. The doorman deserves a special mention going out of his way to get us a taxi to airport after Uber let us down.

great location for shopping and eating out. My wife had her annual high school outing in Chgo. This is our favorite hotel for this purpose. Great staff. friendliest place in town. Are you kidding its Chicago. parking is. Valet is factor that in if your driving.

Excellent. Amazing staff and great room with a great theme aesthetic. The location of this hotel was also amazing and everything that is needed is walking distance. Would definitely return and stay here again on my next trip.

Love this place. We stayed here in Jan 18 and again in April. This last trip to Chicago we stayed at a different hotel and we regretted it. We missed the Talbots friendliness of staff their customer service and general high level of responsiveness. From our two recent stays at Talbot we were obviously spoiled. Next trip back to Chicago Talbot will have our business again.

Excellent customer service Great location. The Talbot in Chicago was a great place for our family to stay for our trip to watch to the Chicago Cubs play ball. We wanted to be near Michigan Avenue so that we could walk around the heart of downtown but it is a very simple walk to the CTA red line L train. The hotel restaurant is more of an appetizer odourves menu with a solid drink selection. The doorman David was extremely nice and helpful along with the concierge staff and bellman crew.

Amazing. We went to Chicago for a quick weekend getaway and this hotel and staff made it the trip of a lifetime. The doorman Perry Martinis was phenomenal. He knew great places for us to go see and amazing restaurants for us to eat at. The location is central to just about everything making it easy to see the sites. The food and cocktails at the bar in the lobby are great and the staff is very friendly there as well. All in all wonderful trip made even better by the staff and great experience at The Talbot.

SOS. Ca nt beat the location BUT One small elevator that requires a 15 20 wait. The other has been broken for 3 m because there is no money to fix it. Food is very fair chewy eggs weak cofe the parent company is at risk of brand damage there are plenty of options. The Thompson being one of them.

Classy modern hotel friendly staff home away from home. I went to Chicago for a business trip and the organization selected the Talbot Hotel for accommodations. I now see why. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiling faces and a chuckle or two. There was a wait for our rooms but it gave us the opportunity to relax in their downstairs lounge area. I felt like I was on vacation rather than business. When we finally got our rooms they far exceeded my expectations. The overall appearance cleanliness and feel felt like a home away from home. Every time we went back to the hotel from our conference space I felt like I was truly able to unwind not just from the day but from months of chaos and running around prior to the conference. I ca n’t wait to go back for an actual vacation and I know where I ’l stay —. The Talbot Hotel.

Bad experience. was nt worth the money our family weekend escape to the city fell extremely short of our expectations. Probably will start looking for new hotel to stay at when i come to the city. It definitely did nt live up to a four star hotel as its advertised.
Amazing location. Staff was great but only 1 elevator working which was very difficult on a busy holiday weekend. Sounds like it has been out for a long time. Otherwise was exceptional.

Missed the mark for a Holiday weekend. Careful if they offer the 16th floor suite upgrade. Make sure both elevators are in service. I think they tricked me and it sucked. Bar staff on Sunday hated each other which made for a really uncomfortable attempt to get hot water for tea after waiting 20 minutes for the hot water dispenser in the lobby to be refilled. We really did loose hours over the course of the weekend just getting up to our room.

Comfortable and clean. This well located hotel was comfortable and clean and given the time and location was a good value for us. We missed or did not see that this is a dog friendly hotel and while we love dogs and love family who have dogs we did not care for them while eating. it is probably not a good fit for us in the future.

Wow first impressions for the Win. I recently did a staycation in Chicago just to get away for the evening. I found The Talbot hotel via my hot wire deal. After reading some reviews and checking out some pictures I was excited to stay here. Upon arrival the doorman Dwayne greeted us with the biggest smile and hello. We walked right to the check in counter and was met by Joshua who went ABOVE AND BEYOND. Not only was he so kind but we also got a room upgrade AND 2 complimentary drink tickets to their lobby bar. How amazing. I was so impressed and I had not even seen the room yet in person lol. The room itself was spacious the view was n’t anything since we were ok between building but that did n’t bother me. The bathroom was nice and the shower was HUGE. About 4 people could fit in there no joke. My favorite part was the bed though. My goodness it was like sleeping on a cloud. One night was n’t enough. The bar was great. The drinks were strong and they had a delicious happy hour menu for food and drinks from 3 5 I believe I took a pictureOveral I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and ca n’t wait to come back.

Will Definitely Stay Here Again. Great service. Great room. Phenomenal location. We over payed because we stayed here for Valentines Day and that same weekend Chicago was hosting the NBA All Star game. So rates were through the roof. But that being said the stay was well worth it and I will definitely be coming back and would prefer to only ever stay here for my return trips to Chicago.

Excellent service. We were here with a large group for a competition. The hotel did an excellent job accommodating us and is beautiful with a great atmosphere. The staff went way above and beyond to take care of anything we needed which made life so nice and we could focus on the kids and their competition. Special shout out to DeWayne and Charles at the front door who were FABULOUS as well as Angie in housekeeping. She was happy to track down anything we needed. Highly recommend this hotel.

Great Experience. Traveling with a large group for color guard competition and had a great experience. Dwayne Charles and Angie were all amazing. All hotel staff were very nice and helpful. 35 people in our group and no complaints.
